Contributor: Morgan, R. G., artist.; Victory Liberty Loan Committee.;
Note: Signed "R.G. Morgan." Date based on date of the Victory Liberty Loan campaign. Orientation: Vertical.
Description: Design for a newspaper and magazine advertisement for the Victory Liberty Loan campaign. The text honors Harold A. Furlong, 1st Lieut. Co. M 353rd Inf., for his gallantry in his action with the enemy near Bantheville, France, November, 1918. The text says he fought for you so subscribe to Liberty Loan. The illustration shows a soldier attacking four enemy soldiers.
Digital Collection: Allied Posters of World War I
Local Rights Statement: This material is made available for private study, scholarship, and research use. For access to the original or a high resolution reproduction, contact: Temple University Libraries, Special Collections Research Center, scrc@temple.edu, 215-204-8257.
